mc or ch4 and slip_stitch in first loop to make circle rnd2 - ch2 counts as first double_crochet here and throughout 2dc ch1 3dc ch1 repeat 5 times slip_stitch in top of ch2 should have six sets of 3dc rnd3 - slip_stitch over to first ch1 gap from previous round ch2 2dc in gap ch3 3dc in same gap ch1 3dc in next gap ch3 3 more double_crochet in same gap ch3 repeat 5 times slip_stitch into top of ch2 rnd4 - slip_stitch over to first ch3 gap from previous round ch2 2dc in ch3 gap ch3 3dc in same gap ch1 *3dc in next gap ch1 3dc in gap made by ch3 in previous round ch3 3dc in same gap ch1 * repeat until the end of round and slip_stitch to beginning ch2 rnd5-9 - repeat round 4 creating a corner 3dc ch3 3dc ch1 in the ch3 gaps and 3dc ch1 in the ch1 gaps i found 9 rounds the perfect amount but if you use bulkier yarn or looser gauge you may need to stop at 8 and if you use finer yarn or tighter gauge you may need to add row i included the dimensions of the cardigans i made at the beginning of the pattern so if you don t have a doll on hand to test it on you can compare it to mine as a guide dollhexagoncardiganpatternbysarahpearson downloadfromravelry patternnotforresale to piece together - sew two sides together to create a back seam i find it easiest to put the sides i choose as the right side together and sewing along through the loops across the top - next to sew the sleeves you need to decide if you want the closed neckline or open neckline picture of rainbow cardi shows closed neckline - closed- fold sides to create a t shape make sure to have it inside out sew across the top of the arms all the way across so sides just meet in the middle where the back seam is - open- sew the same way but stopping to leave two 3dc on each of the front sides and 4 3dc across the back two either side of the back seam - you are done with the basic cardigan but have fun getting creative to change it up maybe you want to change colours for different row maybe you want to make the neckline open then sew a cute button to one corner so it can fasten the sides together another option is to crochet an edge all the way down the front around the bottom and back around you could dop a simple single_crochet round do the same stitch by doing 3dc+ch1 in each gap or something else all together maybe add tassels around the
